name: Zscaler
description: This app implements containment and investigative actions on Zscaler

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Fetch sandbox report for provided md5 file hash

example_values: Binary contains paths to development resources
Sandbox report successfully fetched for the provided md5 hash

actions.verbose: If a url_category is specified, it will add the IP(s) as a rule to that category. If it is left blank, it will instead add the IP(s) to the global blocklist.
If a url_category is specified, it will add the URL(s) as a rule to that category. If it is left blank, it will instead add the URL(s) to the global blocklist.
If a url_category is specified, it will remove the IP(s) from that category. If it is left blank, it will instead remove the IP(s) from the global blocklist.
If a url_category is specified, it will remove the URL(s) from that category. If it is left blank, it will instead remove the URL(s) from the global blocklist.

actions.description: Add an IP address to the allowlist
actions.verbose: If a url_category is specified, it will add the IP(s) as a rule to that category. If it is left blank, it will instead add this IP(s) to the global allowlist.

actions.description: Add a URL to the allowed list
actions.verbose: If a url_category is specified, it will add the URL(s) as a rule to that category. If it is left blank, it will instead add the URL(s) to the global allowed list.

actions.description: Remove an IP address from the allowlist
actions.verbose: If a url_category is specified, it will remove the IP(s) from that category. If it is left blank, it will instead remove the IP(s) from the global allowlist.

actions.description: Remove a URL from the allowed list
actions.verbose: If a url_category is specified, it will remove the URL(s) from that category. If it is left blank, it will instead remove the URL(s) from the global allowed list.
